programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: The race is on when a wealthy doctor seeks the Pirates' help in retrieving a medical chopper from a farm in Cartel country.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Bazillionaire?
programme.desc: Don and the guys are in an industrial area of Toronto for an auction, and Roy hopes there will be some hidden treasures in the industrial lockers.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Father-and-son team Bogart and Paul argue over Paul's propensity to spend, while janitors Mike and Armando make an appearance at the auction.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz locate a 1947 Harley-Davidson Knucklehead, and are given VIP access to the untouched stash of a former antiques shop owner.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Franz pay another visit to Hobo Jack to see if there are any new finds in his junkyard.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick transforms a child's bicycle from the 1970s, and the owner offers to perform stunts on it for the team in return for a discount.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron challenges his protege Leonard to a big rig contest, and the crew works on a rare 1950s British motorcycle.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: New interpretations of ancient texts indicate that Satan may have been an extraterrestrial. This documentary investigates whether these new theories about the ruler of Hell could be accurate.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists search ancient texts for proof that extraterrestrials influenced the miraculous advances made by the Sumerian civilisation 5,000 years ago.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz take their nephew on his first pick and visit the 1890s home that once belonged to an opera singer.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a theme park during a clear-out and later discover some shocking news about a collection of circus posters.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Dublin dealer Ian Dowling and his mate Butzy search for treasures in Cork. Items include a mysterious stone head and a carving of a famous figure from Irish mythology.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones get off to a slow start at a storage auction in Los Angeles, but their fortunes improve when they find a digger, forklift truck tyres and welding equipment.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones score a 1970s skateboard and a bullet-proof vest at an auction in Long Beach, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones are in Hollywood, where despite stiff competition they hope to lay claim to film memorabilia, including an autographed Raging Bull poster.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1970s mechanical bull and a banjo from the 1940s.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Las Vegas, where they acquire a 1950s bumper car and a potato gun launcher.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid for large units in Las Vegas, discovering an antique naval cane sword and a magician's prop from the 1970s.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones investigate one of America's oldest storage facilities, where they uncover a whaling harpoon and a rare US flag.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a Second World War tank barrel after outbidding the competition in Worcester, Massachusetts.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Buyers Darrell, Brandon, Jarrod, Brandi and Ivy head to El Monte, California, where they tackle the local competition head-on.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the hills of Murrieta for an auction that has tensions and prices running high. Dave drives Darrell to breaking-point.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey return to the auctions only to be greeted by fierce competition. Dave finds a piece of board game history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon have high hopes when they return to the site of one of their greatest triumphs, while the other bidders take on the self-proclaimed king of storage.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon fight over a piece of movie history, and Rene plans to make the other bidders pay dearly for coming to his home town.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod tries Brandi's patience as the bidders attend an auction in Koreatown, where valuable merchandise is up for grabs and Dave hopes to make a big profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: An auction is held on Darrell and Brandon's home turf, and Mary hatches a plan to deal with inflated prices.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon experience the sweet taste of success, Mary looks for love and Jarrod and Brandi return to Moreno Valley.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan Dotson returns to the auctions in Costa Mesa, California, where the buyers have their sights set on rival Dave Hester on his home turf.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: Still in Alabama, Dog and his team agree to help Leland hunt down another fugitive. But with Beth feeling unwell and most of the team tied up, things don't go as planned.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Peril strikes during a daring dive threatening to sideline Kevin and his team just as they begin their search of Lake Michigan.

programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: Historian and writer Dan Jones tells the epic story of the rival dynasties that forged the history of medieval and early modern Europe..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites three of the country's finest comic minds to help him make sense of our insensible world. In the first episode he is joined by Richard Osman, Phil Wang and Sara Barron, as they take a deep dive into the details we usually miss.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Not Going Out star and Would I Lie to You? team captain Lee Mack takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster Janet Street-Porter and comedian Sara Pascoe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines in April 2018.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sara Pascoe, Larry Dean, Gary Delaney
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Larry Dean and Gary Delaney.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis host a festive special and are joined by an array of top names form the UK comedy circuit including Ed Byrne, James Acaster, Tom Allen, Rhys James, Zoe Lyons, Ed Gamble, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan for quizzes, challenges, out-takes and unseen material.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon's first night shift coincides with Halloween and an escaped prisoner roaming the wards - will he and Frankie survive?.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part programme, the naturalist travels down the Baliem River's lower gorge, one of the most dangerous stretches of white water in the world surrounded by jagged rock walls. His exploration of the surrounding jungle leads to an encounter with a tribe that has had little contact with the outside world. As he concludes his trek in the river's coastal reaches, he faces a crisis of conscience as he witnesses a traditional crocodile hunt.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the expanding, highly-profitable operations of drug cartels and the federal agents trying to stop them.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the expanding, highly-profitable operations of drug cartels and the federal agents trying to stop them.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: Armed police in Cork hunt for illegal immigrants trying to get into Ireland and officers in Dublin deal with a brother and sister from Hong Kong who claim to be visiting a relative.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: Traffic cops in Dublin pull over a driver suspected of drug offences, while a teenager arrives from France, travelling alone and unable to find those she is meant to be meeting.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May visit Albania to test three luxury vehicles - the Rolls-Royce Ghost, Bentley Mulsanne and Mercedes-Benz S65 AMG. Jeremy also drives three high-performance hatchbacks in the form of the limited-edition Ford Focus RS500, Prodrive-developed Cosworth Impreza STi CS400 and one-off Volvo C30 PPC. Jonathan Ross is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The competing teams' motorless vehicles use gravity as their only form of propulsion in the Belgian capital of Brussels.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Rival teams of amateur racers pit their wacky, gravity-powered soapbox vehicles in a downhill race against the clock in Paris.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The work taking place in one of Britain's leading police car workshops, as bespoke vehicles are built and repairs made to ones that have been out in the field. In the first episode, John Heussi finds himself in need of a new riot van, and stress-testing the old one helps him design a new one.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic long jump champion Greg Rutherford, broadcaster Kirsty Young, actress-writer Joanna Scanlan and comedian Henning Wehn join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Funnyman Jimmy Carr, actor and comedian Griff Rhys Jones, Hairy Biker Dave Myers and news presenter Susanna Reid join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of extra material from the comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Mel Giedroyc, Jason Manford, Sarah Millican, Stephen Mangan, Dermot O'Leary, Charles Dance, Warwick Davis, David Harewood, Bob Mortimer, David O'Doherty and Joanna Scanlan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part programme, the naturalist travels down the Baliem River's lower gorge, one of the most dangerous stretches of white water in the world surrounded by jagged rock walls. His exploration of the surrounding jungle leads to an encounter with a tribe that has had little contact with the outside world. As he concludes his trek in the river's coastal reaches, he faces a crisis of conscience as he witnesses a traditional crocodile hunt.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are on alert for a cartel ambush as they transfer a Sicario to the Mexican military. A random inspection of a pick-up truck reveals 32kg of narcotics.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: Dublin Port security handle a foreign truck that is illegally parked and traffic officers pull over a van driver whose day goes from bad to worse as the misdemeanours mount up.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: An Australian girl's arrival on a flight from the UK raises suspicions at Dublin airport, while Passport and Immigration Officers are faced with a family from Ghana.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Not Going Out star and Would I Lie to You? team captain Lee Mack takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster Janet Street-Porter and comedian Sara Pascoe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines in April 2018.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sarah Millican, Cariad Lloyd and Alice Levine join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the unconventional quiz, this time focusing on the theme 'Objects and Ornaments'. During the course of the show, the panellists discover where to find an actual UFO and meet the world's best-dressed crab. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sara Pascoe, Larry Dean, Gary Delaney
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Larry Dean and Gary Delaney.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the world's biggest oil tanker - the mighty Supertanker Europe of the record-breaking TI Class of ship.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the Normans' expansion toward southern Europe and the Middle East in the 11th century. Southern Italy and Sicily were conquered and a prosperous kingdom flourished on the island, which became an important centre of medieval culture and an example of harmony between religions. However, Pope Urban II's call for holy war against the Muslims, to win Jerusalem back, led to the Normans embarking on the First Crusade.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Historian Stephen Baxter explores his own theory that the Domesday Book was commissioned to confer revolutionary powers on the monarchy in the 11th century, and not intended as a means to collect taxes. He examines how the first great national survey, which recorded who owned every piece of land and property in England, was a massive logistical exercise that documented the traumatic impact of the Norman Conquest.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. The first episode looks at the Allied invasion of Europe, which began on June 6 1944 - D-Day. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: This edition examines the efforts of the British and Canadians who fought elite German divisions to capture the city of Caen, the key to breaking out of Normandy.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Examining the work of the American forces who launched a huge offensive to blast a gap in the German lines and break through to liberate France.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Exploring the history of Westminster Abbey, which dates back to the 11th century and houses more than 500 corpses, including those of Edward I, Elizabeth I, Charles Darwin and Isaac Newton, as well as staging 16 royal weddings. The episode also explores the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The unsolved murders committed by the Butcher of Kingsbury Run, a serial killer operating in Cleveland, Ohio, in the 1930s. The Butcher killed at least 12 men and women, dismembering their bodies and scattering them across the city.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Amelia Dyer, who promised mothers that for a fee she would adopt their babies and raise them as her own. In fact, she neglected and murdered countless infants over a 30-year period in Victorian Britain. This episode tells the story of Dyer and of Evelina Marmon, one of the desperate young mothers she deceived.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene decides to run for the Spanish border but is stopped before he can make it across - and General Von Klinkerhoffen gets hold of the painting. The British airmen become trapped in wine barrels in the cellar of the chateau.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General Von Klinkerhoffen orders Edith to marry Captain Bertorelli as a propaganda exercise, while the resistance tries to rescue the airmen who are trapped in wine barrels in the chateau's cellar. Wartime comedy, starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen get stuck down the drain in the village square, and Rene plans to rescue them using an old ice-cream van. As a result, General Von Klinkerhoffen gets more than he bargained for when he decides to buy one of the cool refreshments on sale. Wartime comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: Documentary following father-and-son duo Dave and Steve Nuwar, who run a military antiques business. In the first edition, Dave takes a gamble when he makes one of his most expensive purchases ever. And with finances tight, the team head to Stratford fair to try and sell some treasures.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: McKenna becomes obsessed with the wife of a wounded war veteran he is treating, while Finlay and Cameron are intrigued by a film star staying in a local hotel. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron agrees to help trace Millie Calm's real mother, but soon wishes he had never got involved. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey Webb, now working with the National Crime Squad, returns to Sun Hill and tells Jack he suspects Neil has ensured the silence of a key witness in a major money laundering trial. Alan Kennedy sets a trap for Samantha, luring her to a deserted warehouse and holding her at knifepoint, while Ramani's suspicions about Margaret grow after a witness statement goes missing.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Neil's world begins to collapse around his ears when his meeting with a key witness in the money laundering trial is followed by her attempted kidnapping. Already paranoid after discovering a bug in his house and an intruder rummaging through his rubbish, the confused copper begins to wonder if somebody's trying to frame him - and his suspicions are confirmed when he's beaten up, drugged and awakes to find himself next to a murdered man.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Neil is hauled into custody on a murder charge, mutual mistrust begins to brew between the Sun Hill regulars and the National Crime Squad team led by Mickey Webb. Ever resourceful, Neil pretends to have hard evidence that a corrupt copper is responsible for his predicament - deliberately provoking an attempt on his own life as a way of proving his innocence.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Margaret falls down a flight of stairs during a tussle with an increasingly harassed Ramani, who has become convinced she's being stalked. Neil returns to Sun Hill, and Yvonne agrees to a date with nurse Nick, only to leave him in the lurch. Samantha and Terry find themselves in a room full of venomous snakes, while Gina faces an ordeal of a different kind as she prepares to start chemotherapy.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Robert's brother Frank comes to stay - and presents the private detective with another intriguing case in the final episode of the light-hearted drama. The daughter of Frank's old flame has gone missing from her new job in a Victorian heritage museum and early investigations indicate that Marianne was last seen running out of the museum in her school mistress costume, following a row with the manager.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Period drama about a 19-year-old woman, who is attacked after an engagement party in honour of a farmer for whom she has feelings. Carli Norris stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Following the destruction of their home by the McGraths, Tilly and her grandmother are forced to live a life of solitude. Period drama, starring Carli Norris.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy try to grant Sam his final wish and sneak him out of his sick-bed for a secret rendezvous - but when he drops dead, things begin to get out of hand. Feature-length Christmas special from 1983, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth receives a cryptic letter from a recently deceased acquaintance asking her to conduct a mysterious investigation. Instructed only to go on a coach tour of historic homes around England, she uncovers murder and intrigue. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, with Peter Tilbury, John Horsley and Helen Cherry.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Reid and Ross investigate the discovery of a mutilated body on a remote island, but find the locals strangely uncommunicative and struggle to make headway. Back in Glasgow, Burke and Fraser link the victim to a drugs operation thanks to a tattoo on his arm - but just as their investigation appears to be on the right track, a mysterious disappearance complicates the case still further.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Burke promises to help an old flame working for a politician who is in trouble for accepting funds from an underworld figure. The investigation into the criminal leads Burke to a shady escort agency, but the case and his reputation are jeopardised when he is caught on camera leaving the building after a raid by vice officers. Detective drama, starring Alex Norton.

programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today with Gillian Joseph.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Knocked Up (2007)
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz, controlling a robot, distributes ice cream to everyone in the city. When Magoo mistakes him for a monster, he gets sprayed with ice cream..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: At the Heart of the Crater
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is at the foot of a volcano, but in fact, he's next to a huge soup vat. And he sets it all awry..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz invents a cucumber that turns people into an object of worship. When Magoo sees people being drawn to Fizz and Weasel, he thinks it's zombies!.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol. Undeterred he manages to get a push, but for some reason the do-gooders don't want to push him all the way to the beach!.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Back stateside, Ben can't get into a cat cosplay competition.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.sub-title: Sacrifice at the Edge of Time
programme.desc: Po decides it's time to figure out a way to defeat Jindiao once and for all before time runs out..

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis gives Hank a basketball.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show presented by John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips. The first episode features spring roast chicken, a fruity curry, Victoria sponge, cheat's raspberry jam and easy cheese scones, and a simple souffle.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott embarks on a journey across the Mediterranean on a 44ft catamaran, preparing a variety of delicious recipes along the way. In this first edition, skipper Jean-Hughes teaches him the basics of sailing, and they drop anchor in a crystal-clear cove on the island of Lavezzi, where Ainsley tries his hand at paddle-boarding. The chef then prepares seafood skewers with pepperonata, and a quick and tasty Corsican mint omelette.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The expert walker chooses her favourite, most accessible family treks in search of the perfect walk with a view that anyone can tackle in a morning or afternoon ramble, venturing off the beaten track and discovering some of Britain's most breath-taking scenery.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live semi-final. Coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor are in the red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for a place on their coach's team.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo return with another edition of the Saturday evening variety show. Tom Jones will be taking to the stage to perform on this week's End of The Show Show, while Bradley Walsh becomes the first repeat victim of Undercover when Ant and Dec invade an episode of The Chase. Plus, keep an eye out for Fleur East, who has another Place on the Plane to give away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Connie Bishop keeps waking in the night, convinced she has an intruder, but most of the villagers in Badger's Drift dismiss her fears as an overactive imagination. Days later, a local councillor thought to have been obsessed with her is found murdered in her garden, and the ensuing investigation by Barnaby and Jones uncovers jealous rivals, ruthless social climbers and a cottage with a few secrets. Guest starring Paul Kaye, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly head judge Shirley Ballas, actress Bhavna Limbachia and This Morning's resident GP Dr Ranj Singh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. The players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a family-themed edition of the game show. Here, instead of teaming up with strangers, the Hartes from Co Antrim work alongside their family members as they pit their general-knowledge know-how against one of the finest quiz brains in the country.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: A medical train rolls into town, providing miracle surgeries and carrying a surprise for Gabriel - a glamorous older surgeon from his past. While he is reminiscing with his old colleague, a vicious attack on one of the team shocks the medics and leaves Lydia reeling, and an elderly British man arrives in India on a romantic mission. Can the doctors help him in his quest? Medical drama set in southern India, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Neil Morrissey and Amrita Acharia, with a guest appearance by Kenneth Cranham.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Kenneth Cranham

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Anne decides that honesty is required, and hopes that seeking confession with Caroline will appease her guilt and lay to rest the ghosts from her past. However, she has sorely underestimated Lady Brockenhurst, who sets about unearthing the secrets that bind the families together. Hosting a prestigious dinner party, she invites a special guest whose presence reveals a deceit James Trenchard would wish to keep private.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part two of two. Joanna completes her Cuban journey by visiting the infamous town of Guantanamo. Giving the prison a wide berth, she discovers that the song Guantanamera was born in the town, and meets a talented young singer who is recording the track herself. She then heads across the Windward Passage to Haiti, currently the poorest country in the Western World. She visits the Citadel, a mighty fortress built to deter colonial powers, before taking in a Voodoo ceremony on the Iles a Vaches.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Peter Cole is worried about the press interest following Maggie's interview and the online petition calling for his resignation over the scandal. Meanwhile, Alex is greeted at work by two money lenders, who have found him because his girlfriend Roxanna's picture appeared in the papers. Author Marcus Ormansby gives a talk at the school, and finds that romance is blossoming between him and Jill. Later, Maggie's visit to Kelly's salon is tense, but they have a heart to heart, leading Kelly to return home to husband Neil and take action over their 'lottery' money.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Comedian Alexei Sayle gets in a spot of bother in his unreliable Italian runaround, rediscovers a long-lost British classic and drives an off-road legend.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen risk their lives in the fight to get their one-tonne digger down a 20-metre deep mine shaft. Plus, new alliances are forged as the Boulder Boys hit pay dirt.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Sgt Major and Sully battle the elements loading two 16-tonne Royal Marines landing craft in Instow, Devon. Plus, the firm add a brand-new truck to their growing fleet.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team begins work on two new projects, but progess is disrupted by an argument between Paul Teutul Jr and his father.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Bill's 1969 Pontiac Firebird is incompatible with his son's disability so he needs Dan to smooth the ride. Plus, Dan transforms a '74 International Harvester Scout.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to tap into 1990s nostalgia by working on an 1994 Mitsubishi 3000GT VR-4, but restoring the vehicle to its original state proves harder than expected.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind sanders, solid terrain models, Stucco and high-speed roll-up doors, and how techniques have developed over time.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Pressed Glass/Pickup Truck Caps/Alpaca Yarn/Utility Knives
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, examining how pressed glass, pick-up truck cabs, alpaca yarn and utility knives are made.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: Living Dinosaur of Liberia: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Paul 'Mungo' Mungeam profiles the Gbahali, a huge crocodilian creature that poses a threat to people living in Liberia.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items in Wensleydale, North Yorkshire, that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to tap into 1990s nostalgia by working on an 1994 Mitsubishi 3000GT VR-4, but restoring the vehicle to its original state proves harder than expected.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rare, rust-free model of a Datsun 240Z California and Edd China swaps the auto for manual transmission, before the pair try to make a profit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John enjoy a tour of the Midlands. In Walsall, they have a money-spinning idea, in Birmingham Drew finds treasure and they also explore a grand country house.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a remote part of Scotland for an epic private house clearance and calls in at an historic cutlery factory in Sheffield.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a dealer in Manchester, haggles with a windmill manager in Kent and seeks artefact redemption at a Somerset abbey. Plus, he moves shop after 10 years in one place.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Scotland to see a Victorian theatre in Aberdeen and the remote town of Rothes. Plus, sidekick Tee shows him how to do a deal at a steam railway in Devon.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard meets an Oxfordshire aristocrat who owns his own steam train, and picks up an American sign and a Victorian oil lamp.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Tom asks Dan to find him a rare 1967 Camaro Convertible with factory air conditioning. However, when Dan finds the Unicorn, the car is too good to cut up.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a BMW Isetta bubble car, but Edd China finds the small vehicle difficult to repair and the pair's chances of turning a profit are put in jeopardy.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items in Wensleydale, North Yorkshire, that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Gloucestershire, Drew Pritchard finds a huge horse's head with a dealer specialising in sculptures. In Somerset he spots a valuable Persian rug lining a chicken shed.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The work of demolition, salvage and waste management experts as they blast, crush and smash their way through a variety of structures which have had their day. In Ironbridge, Shropshire, four massive towers from an old coal station are blown up. Plus, in Wakefield a mother and daughter watch as their house is demolished.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: The previous season, Darrell Miklos located a shipwreck tied to Christopher Columbus using Cooper's intel. Now, he has eight weeks' of cash left to find another shipwreck that he can salvage.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A mother and her two young children mysteriously go missing. Then, two local boys nearby also disappear. Is there a serial predator on the loose in rural Missouri?.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the disappearance of a woman in Key West, Florida, that yielded nothing but a pair of sandals which may have belonged to her. Then two important pieces of video surfaced, and police began to wonder if they should be searching for a missing person or a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The case of a mother-of-two and army wife found dead in her bedroom. There were messages left near her body, and a gun in her hand. Her death was initially ruled a suicide, until investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier and decided to take another look at the evidence to deduce whether murder was a possibility.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Hope Melton vanished after being run off a road, police examined CCTV footage from a nearby petrol station that revealed a suspicious car.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 66-year-old Sharron Erickson, who was raped and murdered in the small Midwestern town of Colon, Nebraska in June 2003. James Marrs, who lived just 75 feet away, was later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of how seven inmates escaped from a New Mexico prison after a convicted murderer broke into the computer room with a handgun and released his accomplices.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The investigators find their work cut out for them on a bitterly cold day after receiving reports that a dog has been spotted without shelter and is causing a disturbance.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a deadly patient - a huge king brown snake that has bitten its own tail - and Andrew checks out a rescue dog with badly deformed back legs.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole has flown in on a private jet with her family to go shopping at the salon - and money is no object in the search for a couture gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: We're Going to Say 'I Do' Underwater!
programme.desc: A bride wants a gown for an underwater ceremony, and an ambitious businesswoman wants a colourful dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: The surgical team tries to help a porpoise that has been left blind by a cataract.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown operates on a dog with a large mass hanging from its back leg.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to treat a puppy born with a cleft palate, and receives a call from worried lifeguards when snakes hit the beach.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a family dog with life-threatening heat stroke, and a terrier with a fear of skateboards. He also needs to collect some alligator saliva.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Former plus-size model and 'big is beautiful' advocate Renee now realises her mortal mistakes, as her weight swells to 600lb and her health crumbles.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Former plus-size model and 'big is beautiful' advocate Renee now realises her mortal mistakes, as her weight swells to 600lb and her health crumbles.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Updates on siblings Steven and Justin Assanti. With Steven recovering from his weight-loss surgery, Justin decided to have the procedure as well. However, family history threatened to stop them from achieving their goals.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of lawyer Royal 'Scoop' Daniel, who vanished in 1997. It later became apparent the Colorado attorney had travelled to Mexico to evade charges of theft and commercial bribery, and it took almost five years to have him returned to America to face justice.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Yukia and Yuneisia need a night out, and a bride visits the shop accompanied by nine bridesmaids.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.sub-title: A Diva and an Opera Singer Walk into a Bridal Shop
programme.desc: A gospel singer and an opera diva both visit the salon, and Yukia cannot resist trying to impress them with her own vocals.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: The sisters are touched by the stories of fathers of the bride who visit their shop, and decide they need to pay more attention to their own dad.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.sub-title: Brides That Inspire and a Project Prom Flyer
programme.desc: Yukia and Yuneisia are inspired by two brides who work to help others and collect dress donations for an appeal.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Here Comes the Bride Again - and Again
programme.desc: Keasha bonds with cancer survivor Jennifer during the search for a dress, and a bad-tempered bride takes her frustrations out on Vera.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides from Baltimore come to the bridal store for a joint appointment - but they have very different ideas, while new fashion director Randy is ready to make his mark.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Jeremy and Zach celebrate their 16th birthdays by going on an outing to the beach with a group of friends.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Matt buys Amy a personal organiser as a Mother's Day gift, but worries his wife may be offended by his gesture.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson Galaxy helps a veteran with PTSD whose therapy cat is making him feel worse. He also deals with a feline that is tearing up its owners' furniture and their marriage.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA seizes a hoard of sick animals, including several roosters, a goat and a pregnant cat. Plus, investigator Scott Wernick confiscates numerous dogs that have been left to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: A woman who met a wall of silence in the search for her birth mother, who she thinks once visited her. Plus, a family's tragedy that turned to healing during a reunion.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: After Kay Weden found her 77-year-old mother Catherine Miller shot dead in her home, investigators discovered the frozen remains of her boyfriend in the Blue Ridge Mountains. When investigators spoke with Kay, they realised that she was being stalked.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.
